newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft to post fix for Explorer.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft to post fix for Explorer.

text.p: Microsoft Corp Thursday said it plans to post a software fix on its web site later today to address a potential security problem with the company's Internet Explorer browser.

The problem, which was discovered on Wednesday, could allow a malicious web site to execute a program on a user's computer without permission via Microsoft's PowerPoint software, a presentation program included with Microsoft's Office suite.

When an Internet user clicks on a hyperlink on a web site to a PowerPoint presentation, PowerPoint is launched automatically. If the web site had malicious intentions, the program could delete files or upload private information without the user knowing.
A spokeswoman said Microsoft would post a fix later today and a second fix specifically geared to the PowerPoint software soon. Microsoft said no users have been affected by the problem.
News of the bug was reported Thursday by the online news service Cnet.
Microsoft said the problem could affect other browsers besides Internet Explorer.
